title.romaji: Boku no Kokoro no Yabai Yatsu

description:
Fascinated by murder and all things macabre, Kyoutarou daydreams of acting out his twisted fantasies on his unsuspecting classmates — but an encounter with Anna Yamada, the gorgeous class idol, lights a spark in the darkness of his heart. It’s a classic tale of an antisocial boy falling for a popular girl, but neither are who they appear to be at first glance. Will Kyoutarou and Anna defy their expectations of each other — and of themselves?

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: เธอผู้อันตรายต่อใจผม

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://yorushika.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nbuna_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yorushika_official_/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4UK2Lzi6fBfUi9rpDt6cik)__

__Introduction:__
Yorushika is a Japanese rock duo under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under record label U&R Records (2017-2019). The group consists of N-buna (stylized as n-buna), a former vocaloid music producer and Suis, a female vocalist. The duo as of now is very secretive about their identity, and has never revealed their faces nor held many concerts. As a band they have only ever held two concerts, one in July, 2017 and another one in August, 2019.

The band's music is described as "passionate", "positive" and "upbeat", which serves as a signifcant contrast to the heavier lyrics. The lyrics often explore ideas such as love and human emotion and take inspiration from works of literature by Masuji Ibuse and Jules Verne. The group's name "Yorushika" is taken from the lyrics in their song "Kumo to Yuurei": "Yoru shika mou nemurezu ni" (meaning "I can only sleep at night"). Their eye-designed logo mark is a motif of two moons facing each other, which also serves as a clock hand, portraying the time "from 6:00 to night".

__Biography:__
Prior to the formation of the band Yorushika, N-buna already had a rather large following on the site Nico Nico Douga, a Japanese video hosting site, where he would first start releasing vocaloid music back in 2012. A year later in 2013, he would release a song titled "Toumei Elegy", which would peak on the platform's daily vocaloid rankings. Additionally, N-buna has produced two albums through U&R Records, a subsidiary of Nico Nico Douga's owner DWANGO Co., Ltd.

According to an interview with Japanese entertainment news website Natalie, N-buna and Suis met through a common acquantance, and at the time Suis was a longtime fan of N-buna's vocaloid work. Suis then later first appeared as a guest vocalist during N-buna's two solo concerts in Tokyo. After this N-buna reached out to Suis to form Yorushika as part of N-buna's effort to find a "more human" voice to use in his music, as opposed to the usual vocaloid. Since then, the two have released two EPs and three full albums, all of which have charted on both the Oricon Albums Chart and the Billboard Japan Hot 100 Albums Chart with their latest album "Plagiarism" reaching number one on the latter. Yorushika's popularity grew explosively through these rankings, with critics noting that the lyrics seemed to strike a chord with the younger audiences.

In 2020 Yorushika were nominated for the MTV Europe Music Awards in the category "Best Japanese Act".
They also won the "Top 5 new Artists" award at the 34th Japan Golden Disc Award.

Their faces and detailed personal profiles have not yet been disclosed to the public as they want their audiences to listen to their music without "preconceptions".

__Members:__
- [n-buna](https://anilist.co/staff/159212/nbuna) (ナブナ) – guitarist and in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [Suis](https://anilist.co/staff/241696) (スイ) – vocalist

__Support Members:__
- Mitsuyasu Shimozuru (下鶴光康) – guitarist
- [Tatsuya Kitani](https://anilist.co/staff/161639/Tatsuya-Kitani) (キタニタツヤ) – bassist
- Masack (マサック) – drummer
- Tetsuya Hirahata (平畑徹也) – pianist

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

__[Website](https://avex.jp/kohanalam/) | [Profile (Avex)](https://avexnet.jp/contents/music_j/KOHAN-OFCL-0001/profile/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Lam_dayo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCW0p7VdWVO0bn0_FELopJpQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lam_dayo/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@lam_dayo) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1I24D95GZP1Nr9hVsiOLmw)__

She began her music career on YouTube in October 2019. Her "while crying" and "with a lot of emotion" series of songs have become very popular since April 2021 and gained massive fans in just 6 months before her first major label debut. 

Since 2021 she began releasing her songs under the record label Avex Entertainment Inc., and affiliated with Granite agency.
Producer, representative director of Shin-Ei Animation.

title.native: 中二病でも恋がしたい!
久保さんは僕を許さない
古見さんは、コミュ症です。
私がモテないのはどう考えてもお前らが悪い!
イジらないで、長瀞さん
からかい上手の高木さん
中二病でも恋がしたい！戀
その着せ替え人形は恋をする
君は放課後インソムニア
心が叫びたがってるんだ。
さくら荘のペットな彼女
それでも歩は寄せてくる
事情を知らない転校生がグイグイくる。
好きな子がめがねを忘れた
やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。完 「だから、思春期は終わらずに、青春は続いていく。」
山田くんとLv999の恋をする
